alert.note: Alert for Belknap; Grafton (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 24 at 3:24AM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: .Recent rainfall and snowmelt has led to several ice jams along the Pemigewasset River in Grafton and Belknap counties. Water levels have crested and will continue to slowly decrease through today with the return of colder temperatures. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR AN ICE JAM REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON EST TODAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by ice jamming continues. * WHERE...Portions of central and northern New Hampshire, including the following counties, in central New Hampshire, Belknap. In northern New Hampshire, Grafton. * WHEN...Until noon EST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Some water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 315 AM EST, Trained weather spotters reported flooding near the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Plymouth, Holderness, Ashland, Bridgewater, Campton, and New Hampton. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Water levels can rise and fall quickly in the vicinity of ice jams. Those with interests along rivers and tributary streams should be alert for rapidly fluctuating water levels in the vicinity of ice jams. Forecast values represent ice-free flow.
